utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi there, I, I've had this cough that started um, three days ago, and over these past couple of days, I've just been really achy all over and so, I've had a headache as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, well I'm sorry to hear that you're not feeling well. Um, the cough, when did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so that, about three or four days ago um, it started to come on, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and then how about the headache?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That's been more in the last two days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Two days, okay, and then the uh, muscle ache?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's been there for about two, yeah about two or three days. I wake up in the morning and I've been feeling like really fatigued and achy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, the cough, is it dry or you're bringing up phlegm?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's, it's dry, but it's gotten a little bit worse since it started. It's just been happening more often.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and does it sound harsh?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, maybe a little bit, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Is it getting worse do you think?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, are you experiencing any shortness of breath along with the cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, a little bit after, um, if I have like a coughing fit that's bad enough, but um, for the most part, I've been okay.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, any wheeziness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. Chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Do you ever feel like your heart's racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't felt like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, any dizziness or fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uh, numbness or tingling?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uh confusion or memory loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: This headache, is it always there?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: These past couple of days, yeah, it's kind of, it, it's been there. It's been a little bit more mild after using some Tylenol or Advil to help settle it down, but I just have this, yeah, achiness in the front, front of my forehead and kind of sides of my head.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah um, sides of your head, okay. And 1 to 10, 10 being the worst pain you've ever felt, how, how would you rate it?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: A 4 okay, so it's not the worst headache you've ever had in your life?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's not that bad, it's just been pretty annoying.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah um, okay. And have you like, do you usually get headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not really it, yeah I don't get them that often. I guess they come when I, I, well, get sick.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay yeah, that makes sense. Um, have you had any fevers recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I have felt a bit hot um, and, but I, I didn't check my temperature and um, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. How about weight loss, have you experienced any weight loss recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been, my weight's been pretty stable.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, any rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't noticed any rashes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, um, and any changes in your hearing or vision?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Runny nose or stuffy nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, yeah, now that you mention it, I have had a little bit of a sore throat as well. Hasn't been too painful with um, like swallowing uh, foods or anything like that. It's kind of worse in the morning and it's not so bad later on.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay um, alright. How about changes in your smell or taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, changes in your bowel movements?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been uh, regular.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay um, and then nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope, I haven't had anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay um, changes in your urine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've had UTIs, like one or two in the past, um, so I know what that's like. So yeah, everything's been normal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, good. And are you otherwise healthy or do you have any longstanding medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, I have asthma, which I will like, asthma and allergies, and I'll use um, just Ventolin for that every like once in awhile, but it hasn't bugged me too frequently.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, do you also take anything else for that asthma or is it just the Ventolin that use?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah just Ventolin.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Have you had any hospitalizations or surgeries in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, well I, I've had my, my wisdom teeth taken out and, actually yeah I had my tonsils out as well when I was 12.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, are you on any medications besides Ventolin?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah I, I currently, I think a birth control.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, how long have you been on that for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, since high school, so I, yeah since I was 18 so eight years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and um, are you up to date with all your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I am, yeah. I get the flu shot every year.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, okay, good. Any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah, to cats and um, like, I think environmental triggers. No medicines.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No medicines, okay. Any family history of lung or heart diseases?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, my grandfather had, had a stroke when he was in his 70s and um, but he was like, a smoker and a drinker, and didn't really look after himself very well unfortunately, and uh, but that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, um and do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, okay. Any other recreational drugs like marijuana, cocaine, heroin or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't use anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. How about um, alcohol, do you drink?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, sometimes, I'll have a or maybe a cocktail on the weekend, or um, a glass of wine with dinners.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Are you currently sexually active?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I am, yeah with uh, with my boyfriend. Um, we use uh, condoms as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, so you use both condoms and you're on birth control so, okay good, that's a lot of protection. Um, how long have you two been together?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, uh six months.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, okay, good. And um, any sick contacts recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, not that I'm aware of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, okay. Any travel recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope, just been um, going to, or just been doing online uh, classes. I'm finishing up my masters right now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, okay wow, congrats.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, and where do you live and who do you live with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I live in an apartment downtown here um, just with uh one of, one of my friends who's a roommate.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and is everyone at home healthy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, she hasn't had any any symptoms, any symptoms either.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Okay, well those were all the questions that I had for you. Did you have any questions um, or anything that you wanted to bring up that I haven't covered?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, that's it. I was just uh, I mean concerned about COVID. I've been hearing about this new variant and stuff on the news so, a little bit worried.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah for sure. We will definitely um, take a swab from you today and we'll see um, what the results are. You should hear back in about 24 to 48 hours, but in the meantime you should self isolate for 14 days um, and if it's not COVID, if that comes back negative, and um yeah, some of your symptoms also sound like other typical viral symptoms, so you could have one of the common strains that's going around this time of year. So for that just, it's um, you should just um, do some supportive care, you know, staying hydrated, eating well. And if your symptoms become worse, uh, you're running a really high fever, you have any neurological symptoms like weakness or seizures, then you should seek help from the ER. How does that sound?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That sounds good. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
